intro: Crucifera boreava, commonly known as the northern crucifer, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant has a compact growth habit with alternate, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its fruits are dry pods called siliques, which contain several small, round seeds. Native to cold climates, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or arctic regions.
